<tr id="Identifier">
<td id="dcterms:identifier" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:identifier</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>

<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  ‘Yes’ for media collections, ‘No’ for media resources (but preferred if available) — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">An arbitrary code that is unique for the resource, with the resource being either a provider, collection, or media item.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-identifier">dcterms:identifier</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Using multiple identifiers implies that they have a same-as relationship, i.e. they all identify the same object (e. g. an object may have an http-URL, and lsid-URI, and a GUID-number).</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:identifier — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> ncd:collectionId — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> URL with id — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> System ID — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Resource_ID — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> mix2:<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">BasicDigitalObjectInformation/ObjectIdentifier</a><sup id="cite_ref-mix2_0-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mix2-0">[1]</a></sup></td>

<tr id="Type">
<td id="dcterms:type" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:type</td>
</tr>

<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  Yes — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Any dcmi type term from <a target="_blank" class="external free" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-type-vocabulary/">http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-type-vocabulary/</a> may be used. Recommended terms are <i>Collection</i>, <i>StillImage</i>, <i>Sound</i>, <i>MovingImage</i>, <i>InteractiveResource</i>, <i>Text</i>. Also recommended are <i>PanAndZoomImage</i> , <i>3DStillImage</i>, and <i>3DMovingImage</i>.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-type">dcterms:type</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A Collection should be given type <a target="_blank" class="external free" href="http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Collection">http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Collection</a>. If the resource is a Collection, this item does <i>not</i> identify what types of objects it may contain. Following the DC recommendations at <a target="_blank" class="external free" href="http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text">http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Text</a>, images of text should be marked as <i>Text</i>.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:type — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> ncd:CollectionType — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Type — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Type pro parte — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Subtype">

<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Any of Drawing, Painting, Logo, Icon, Illustration, Graphic, Photograph, Animation, Film, SlideShow, DesignPlan, Diagram, Map, MusicalNotation, IdentificationKey, ScannedText, RecordedText, RecordedOrganism, TaxonPage, MultimediaLearningObject, VirtualRealityEnvironment, GlossaryPage. 
These values may either be used in their literal form, or with their full namespace, e. g. http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/terms/identificationKey</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">This does not apply to Collection objects. Conforming applications may choose to ignore these.</td></tr>

</tr> 




<tr id="Title">
<td id="dcterms:title" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:title</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://purl.org/dc/terms/title</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Title</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  Yes — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Concise title, name, or brief descriptive label of institution, resource collection, or individual resource. This field should include the complete title with all the subtitles, if any.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-title">dcterms:title</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The title facilitates interactions with humans: e.g. the title could be used as display text of hyperlinks or to provide a choice of images in a pick list. The title is therefore highly useful and an effort should be made to provide it, where not already available. When the resource is a collection without an institutional or official name, but with a thematic content, a descriptive title, e. g. “Urban Ants of New England” would be suitable. In individual media resources depicting taxa, the scientific name or names of taxa often form a good title. Common names in addition to or instead of scientific names are also acceptable. Indications of action or roles captured by the media resource, such as predatory acts, are desirable (“Rattlesnake eating deer mouse”, “Pollinators of California Native Plants”).</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> dcterms:title — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Title for media resource, or Collection Title for a collection, for Provider or institution it matches the Name/Roles pair combination — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Title — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 





<tr id="Modified">
<td id="dcterms:modified" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:modified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://purl.org/dc/terms/modified</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Modified</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Extended — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Date that the media resource was altered. The date and time must comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org">W3C</a>) <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime">datetime practice</a>, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=40874">8601:2004</a>. AC datetime values may also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). See also  the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">wikipedia IS0 8601 entry</a> for further explanation and examples.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-modified">dcterms:modified</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">dcterms:modified permits all modification dates to be recorded, or if only one is recorded, it is assumed to be the latest.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> Same as dcterms:modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b> http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/ModifyDate — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> dcterms:modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Date Modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> mix2:<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">ChangeHistory/ImageProcessing/dateTimeProcessed</a><sup id="cite_ref-mix2_0-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mix2-0">[1]</a></sup></td>
</tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/MetadataDate</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Metadata Date</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Point in time recording when the last modification to metadata (not necessarily the media object itself) occurred. The date and time must comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org">W3C</a>) <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime">datetime practice</a>, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=40874">8601:2004</a>. AC datetime values may also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). See also  the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">wikipedia IS0 8601 entry</a> for further explanation and examples.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/xmp/pdfs/XMPSpecificationPart1.pdf">, XMP Specification Part 1, Sec  8.4 </a>  for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">This is not dcterms:modified, which refers to the resource itself rather than its metadata. A use case is incremental harvesting: the holder of metadata who also holds the resources may be receiving metadata more frequently than the underlying resources; thus this date information may help a user harvesting the metadata to decide whether updating is necessary.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:modified referring to a "metadata resource". — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b> http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/MetadataDate. IPTC Extension 1.0 also provides IPTC Metadata Last Edited = 
http://iptc.org/std/Iptc4xmpExt/1.0/xmlns/IptcLastEdited - which, however, seem to be limited to modifications of IPTC fields alone. — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> dcterms:modified Collection-&gt;formationPeriod? — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> BaseObject.dateModified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Date Record Modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Metadata_Modified — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 





<tr id="Metadata_Language">
<td id="metadataLanguage" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: metadataLanguage</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/terms/metadataLanguage</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Metadata Language</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  Yes — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Language of description and other metadata (but not necessarily of the image itself) represented in ISO639-1 or -3.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">This is NOT dcterms:language, which is about the resource, not the metadata. This is deliberately single-valued, imposing a requirement that multi-lingual metadata be represented as separate, complete, metadata records in which also the language-neutral items appear. Consumers can re-combine records by identity of multimedia Resource IDs (which are highly recommended to supply). In the face of metadata records of several languages for the same resource, this normative document offers no guidance as to how to disambiguate what language applies to what metadata. To disambiguate this, the metadata provider can provide a separate AC object for each different MetadataLanguage, each such AC object referring to the same multimedia resource Identifier. This comes at a cost of repeated data for the "language neutral" metadata items, but the alternative is to have a complex hierarchical structure for an AC object. Nothing in this document would prevent an implementer, e. g. of an XML-Schema representation, from providing a fully hierarchical schema and disambiguating that way. Users of particular implementation should consult documentation specific for that implementation on this point, but it should always be correct, if convenient, to provide one metadata record per language.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:language referring to a "metadata resource". — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> "English" — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Language of Cataloging — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Metadata_Language — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A rating of the media resources, provided by users or editors, with -1 defining “rejected”, “0” defining “unrated”, and “1” (worst) to “5” (best).</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/xmp/pdfs/XMPSpecificationPart1.pdf">, XMP Specification Part 1, Sec  8.4 </a>  for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF., which contains "A user-assigned rating for this file. The value shall be -1 or in the 
<p>range [0..5], where -1 indicates “rejected” and 0 indicates “unrated”. 
If xmp:Rating is not present, a value of 0 may be assumed.
NOTE   Anticipated usage is for a typical “star rating” UI, with the addition of 
</p>
a notion of rejection." Values may be decimal numbers in the permitted range.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The origin of the rating is not communicated. It may, e. g., be based on user feedback or on editorial ratings. If Rating is not present, a value of 0 may be assumed.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b> http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/Rating — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> NA — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Rating — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

There is a separate item for reviewer comments, which is defined more as an expert-level review.</td></tr>

<tr id="Reviewer">

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">If present, then resource is peer-reviewed, even if Reviewers Comments are lacking. Must display a name or the literal "anonymous" (= anonymously reviewed).</td>

<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The date (often a range) that the resource became or will become available. The date and time must comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org">W3C</a>) <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime">datetime practice</a>, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=40874">8601:2004</a>. AC datetime values may also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). See also  the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">wikipedia IS0 8601 entry</a> for further explanation and examples.</td>
</tr>

<tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-available">dcterms:available</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A use case is, for example, that metadata, potentially including occurrence records, are published before even before the media are available, which are pending a formal publication elsewhere.</td></tr>

<tr id="Copyright_Statement">
<td id="dcterms:rights" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:rights</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Copyright Statement</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  Yes — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Information about rights held in and over the resource. A full-text, readable copyright statement, as required by the national legislation of the copyright holder. On collections, this applies to all contained objects, unless the object itself has a different statement. Examples: “Copyright XY 2008, all rights reserved”, “© 2008 XY Museum” , "Public Domain.", "Copyright unknown" Do not place just the name of the copyright holder(s) here! That belongs in a list in the xmpRights:Owner field, which should be supplied if dcterms:rights is not 'Public Domain', appropriate only if the resource is known to be not under copyright.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-rights">dcterms:rights</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">This expresses rights over the media resource, not over the metadata text.</td></tr>

</tr> 





<tr id="Copyright_Owner">

</tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Copyright Owner</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not. See the Comments below for this term.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/xmp/pdfs/XMPSpecificationPart1.pdf">, XMP Specification Part 1, Sec  8.5 </a>  for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Some providers use dcterms:publisher for this purpose, but it seems doubtful that the publisher is by necessity the copyright owner.  'Public Domain' is not an appropriate value because it denotes something that is not under copyright.  In this case, omit or leave empty xmpRights:Owner, leave empty or absent, and put 'Public Domain' in the Copyright Statement (dcterms:rights). Except for 'Public Domain' resources, it is strongly urged that this field be supplied.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:rights or dcterms:rightsHolder — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b> http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/rights/Owner type bag ProperName, "An unordered array specifying the legal owner(s) of a resource". — Note: IPTC Extension 1.0: also has Copyright Owner, using <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iptc.org/std/photometadata/2008/specification/IPTC-PhotoMetadata-2008_2.pdf">plus:CopyrightOwner</a> <sup id="cite_ref-plus_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-plus-1">[2]</a></sup> — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> contained within Rights Statement = — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Copyright_Owner — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

<tr id="Description">
<td id="dcterms:description" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:description</td>

<tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://purl.org/dc/terms/description</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Description</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Description of collection or individual resource, containing the Who, What, When, Where and Why as free-form text. This normative document is silent on the nature of formatting in the text. It is the role of implementers of an AC concrete representation (e.g. an XML Schema, an RDF representation, etc.) to decide and document how formatting advice will be represented in Descriptions serialized according to such representations.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-description">dcterms:description</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">It optionally allows to present detailed information and will in most cases be shown together with the resource title. If both description and caption (see below) are present, a description is typically displayed instead of the resource, a caption together with the resource.

<h2><span class="editsection">[<a href="/w/index.php?title=Audubon_Core_Term_List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Geography Vocabulary">edit</a>]</span> <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography_Vocabulary"> Geography Vocabulary </span></h2>
<p>Location created and Location shown are separated in the current version of IPTC, and the metadata working group (MWG 2010)<sup id="cite_ref-MWG2010_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MWG2010-2">[3]</a></sup> also recommends this. We will follow this, to support the expected future increase of automatic GPS based coordinate recording in recording devices. As a special case, the AC group recommends to change the semantics of location shown in the case of biodiversity specimens, where the original location may differ from the current location at which the specimen is held in a collection. In this case, LocationShown should exclusively refer to the location where a specimen was originally collected (gathering or sampling location). Use LocationCreated to express the location where the media was created (a specimen was digitized).
</p><p>All geography terms from the DarwinCore <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/2009-12-07/terms/#dcterms">version of 12 09 2009</a> are deemed included in the Core Layer. Specifically, this includes exactly those which are declared by DarwinCore to be in DarwinCore Class <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/2009-12-07/terms/#dcterms:Location">Location</a>.  Note that <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/locality">dwc:locality</a> may be used, but as applied to media this term may be ambiguous as to whether it applies to the location depicted or the location at which the media was created. When disambiguating information is available, it is better to use the terms <i>Location Shown</i> and <i>Location Acquired</i>
</p>

Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>

</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">We distinguish Locality in the sense of Darwin Core (= a complete description of a locality, with the possible exception of country names etc., which can be separated into dwc:HigherGeography), and Sublocation in the sense of IPTC/XMP, i.e. the further details below a city or other place name, of a free-form text location within a fully hierarchically arranged grouping (earlier IPTC versions used “Location”, but this has been renamed as of 2008).</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:coverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b> related to dwc:location, but dwc:location may be a complete location, while sublocation is the remainder in a hierarchy — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Locality — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> (not supported, compare Location) — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

<h2><span class="editsection">[<a href="/w/index.php?title=Audubon_Core_Term_List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Temporal Coverage Vocabulary">edit</a>]</span> <span class="mw-headline" id="Temporal_Coverage_Vocabulary">Temporal Coverage Vocabulary</span></h2>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" border="0" style="border-top: 1px solid #CCC; border-left: 1px solid #CCC; margin-bottom:10px;">




<tr id="Temporal_Coverage">
<td id="dcterms:temporal" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dcterms:temporal</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://purl.org/dc/terms/temporal</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Temporal Coverage</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Extended — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The coverage (extent or scope) of the content of the resource. Temporal coverage will typically include temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) to which the subjects of the media or media collection relate. If dates are mentioned, they should follow ISO 8601. When the resource is a Collection, this refers to the temporal coverage of the collection.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-temporal">dcterms:temporal</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Examples in English: "Jurassic", "Elizabethan", "Spring, 1957". 2008-01-01/2008-06-30. If the resource is video or audio, it refers to the time span, if any, depicted by the resource. For live-media this is closely related to Creation Date and time (Example: the time depicted by a time-lapse video file of organism development), but for media with fictional content it is not.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:temporal — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b> dwc:earliestDateCollected and dwc:latestestDateCollected — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> ncd:temporalCoverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Temporal Coverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> not available yet — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Original Date and Time</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The date of the creation for the original resource from which the digital media was derived or created. The date and time must comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org">W3C</a>) <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime">datetime practice</a>, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=40874">8601:2004</a>. AC datetime values may also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). See also  the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">wikipedia IS0 8601 entry</a> for further explanation and examples.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/content/dam/Adobe/en/devnet/xmp/pdfs/XMPSpecificationPart1.pdf">, XMP Specification Part 1, Sec  8.4 </a>  for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">What is what constitutes "original" is determined by the metadata author. Example: Digitization of a photographic slide of a map would normally give the date at which the map was created; however a photographic work of art including the same map as its content may give the date of the original photographic exposure. Imprecise or unknown dates can be represented as ISO dates or ranges. Compare also Date and Time Digitized.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:date — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> Collection-&gt;temporalCoverage? — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Date Original — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Original_Creation_Date — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The Setting of the content represented in a medium like images, sounds, movies. Constrained vocabulary of: "Natural" = Unmodified object in a natural setting of unmodified object (e. g. living organisms in their natural environment); "Artificial" = Unmodified object in artificial setting of (e. g. living organisms in artificial environment: Zoo, Garden, Greenhouse, Laboratory; photographic background or background sound suppression). "Irrelevant" (e. g. background of Museum shots).</td>
</tr>

<tr id="Subject_Category">
<td id="Iptc4xmpExt:CVterm" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: Iptc4xmpExt:CVterm</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://iptc.org/std/Iptc4xmpExt/1.0/xmlns/CVterm</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>

<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Controlled vocabulary of subjects to support broad classification of media items. Terms from various controlled vocabularies may be used. AC-recommended vocabularies are preferred and may be unqualified literals (without a URI). For terms from other vocabularies either a precise URI should be used, or, when providing unqualified terms, to provide the source vocabulary in Subject Category Vocabulary.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">IPTC terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iptc.org/std/photometadata/specification/IPTC-PhotoMetadata-201007_1.pdf">IPTC Standard Photo Metadata (July 2010)</a> for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Recommended sets include: tha NASA Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) <sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">[4]</a></sup>, K2N <sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">[5]</a></sup>, the BioComplexity Thesaurus<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[6]</a></sup>, the Description Type GBIF Vocabulary <sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[7]</a></sup>, the TDWG Species Profile Model <sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">[8]</a></sup>, the Pinian Core <sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[9]</a></sup> and the European Environmental Agency GEneral Multilingual Environmental Thesaurus(GEMET) <sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[10]</a></sup>. The vocabulary may include major taxonomic groups (such as “vertebrates” or “fungi”) or ecosystem terms (“savannah”, “temperate rain forest”, “forest fires”, “aquatic vertebrates”). Other formal classifications (published in print or online) such as habitat, fuel, invasive species, agroproductivity, fisheries, migratory species etc. also can are also suitable.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:subject — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> Collection-&gt;taxonCoverage? — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Controlled subject; Formal Classification — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Subject Category — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
