<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">General keywords or tags.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Tags may be multi-worded phrases. Where scientific names, common names, geographic locations, etc. are separable, these should go into the more specific metadata items provided further below. Examples: "flower diagram". Character or part keywords like "leaf", "flower color" are especially desirable.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:subject — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> View.specimenPart — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Uncontrolled Subject — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:General Keywords — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 



</table>
<p><br />
</p>
<h2><span class="editsection">[<a href="/w/index.php?title=Audubon_Core_Term_List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Taxonomic Coverage Vocabulary">edit</a>]</span> <span class="mw-headline" id="Taxonomic_Coverage_Vocabulary">Taxonomic Coverage Vocabulary</span></h2>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" border="0" style="border-top: 1px solid #CCC; border-left: 1px solid #CCC; margin-bottom:10px;">




<tr id="Taxon_Coverage">
<td id="ncd:taxonCoverage" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: ncd:taxonCoverage</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/CollectiontaxonCoverage</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Taxon Coverage</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A higher taxon (e. g., a genus, family, or order) at the level of the genus or higher, that covers all taxa that are the primary subject of the resource (which may be a media item or a collection).</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Example:  Where the subject of an image is several species of ducks with trees visible in the background, Taxon Coverage would still be Anatidae (and not Biota).  Example: “Aves” for a bird key or a bird image collection. Do not add a rank (“Class Aves”) in this field. Note that this somewhat expands the usage of ncd:taxonCoverage, which specifies at the Family level or higher. For collections it is recommended to follow ncd:taxonCoverage to avoid conflicts between an AC record and a record arising from NCD. If the resource contains a single taxon, this should be placed in Scientific Name. In this case Taxon Coverage may be left empty, but if not, care should be taken that the entries do not conflict. Example: If Scientific Name is <i>Quercus alba</i> then Taxon Coverage, if provided at all, should be <i>Quercus</i>.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:subject (not coverage!) — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> ncd:taxonCoverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> Specimen.scientificName — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> NA — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Taxonomic Coverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Taxon_Name">
<td id="dwc:scientificName" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dwc:scientificName</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/scientificName</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Taxon Name</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Taxon names of organisms represented in the media resource (with date and authorship information if available) of the lowest level taxonomic rank that can be applied.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/#scientificName">dwc:scientificName</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The Taxon Name may possibly be a Genus or Family name, if this is the most specific identification available. Where multiple taxa are the subject, multiple names may be given. If possible, add this information here even if the title or caption of the resource already contains scientific names. Where the list of scientific names is impractically large (e. g., media collections or identification tools), the number of taxa should be given in Taxon Count (see below). If possible, please do not repeat the Taxonomic Coverage here. Do not use abbreviated Genus names ("P. vulgaris"). It is recommended to provide author citation to scientific names, to avoid ambiguities in the presence of homonyms (the same name created by different authors for different taxa). Identifier qualifications should be supplied in the Identification Qualifier term rather than here (i. e. “Abies cf. alba” is deprecated, to be replaced with Scientific Name = “Abies alba” and Identification Qualifier = “cf. species”).</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:subject — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b> dwc:scientificName — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> Collection-&gt;taxonCoverage? — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b> Specimen.scientificName — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Scientific Name — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Scientific Names — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Identification_Qualifier">
<td id="dwc:identificationQualifier" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dwc:identificationQualifier</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/identificationQualifier</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Identification Qualifier</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">A brief phrase or a standard abbreviation ("cf. genus", "cf. species", "cf. var.", "aff. species", etc.) to express the determiner's doubts with respect to a specified taxonomic rank about the identification given in Scientific Name.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/#identificationQualifier">dwc:identificationQualifier</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Splitting identification qualification and scientific name into separate fields is recommended practice in cases where only a single taxon name is available, or if the exchange format is able to keep relations between multiple names and identification qualifiers. Where the exchange format only supports simple multiplicities, a media item with  multiple scientific names, some with, some without identification qualifiers, may have to be transferred with  "cf." or "aff." qualifiers remaining embedded in the scientific name.
<p>For discussion of Darwin Core usage see <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://code.google.com/p/darwincore/wiki/Identification">here</a>.
</p>
Examples: 1) For the determinations “cf. Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia”, “Quercus cf. agrifolia var. oxyadenia”, “Quercus agrifolia cf. var. oxyadenia”, Scientific Name would always be “Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia”, with Identification Qualifier “cf. genus”, “cf. species” and “cf. var.”, respectively.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b> dwc:identificationQualifier — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Common_Name">
<td id="dwc:vernacularName" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dwc:vernacularName</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/vernacularName</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Common Name</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Common (= vernacular) names of the subject in one or several languages. The ISO language name should be given in parentheses after the name if not all names are in Metadata Language.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/#vernacularName">dwc:vernacularName</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The ISO language codes after the name should be formatted as in the following example: 'abete bianco (it); Tanne (de); White Fir (en)'. If names are known to be male- or female-specific, this may be specified as in: 'ewe (en-female); ram (en-male);'.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:subject — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b> ncd:commonNameCoverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Common Name — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Common Names — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Name_According_To">
<td id="dwc:nameAccordingTo" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: dwc:nameAccordingTo</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/nameAccordingTo</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Name According To</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Extended — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The taxonomic authority used to apply the name to the taxon, e. g., a book or web service from which the name comes from.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/#nameAccordingTo">dwc:nameAccordingTo</a></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Examples are "ITIS", "Catalogue of Life", "Peterson's guide for birds".</td></tr>
<tr>

<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">An exact or estimated number of taxa at the lowest applicable taxon rank (usually species or infraspecific) represented by the media resource (item or collection).</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>

<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Primarily intended for resource collections and singular resources dealing with sets of taxa (e. g., identification tools, videos). It is recommended to give an exact or estimated number of specific taxa when a complete list of taxa is not available or practical. The count should contain only the taxa covered fully or primarily by the resource. For a taxon page and most images this will be “1”, i. e. other taxa mentioned on the side or in the background should not be counted. However, sometimes a resource may illustrate an ecological or behavioral entity with multiple species, e. g., a host-pathogen interaction; taxon count would then indicate the known number of species in this interaction. This should be a single integer number. Leave the field empty if you cannot estimate the information (do not enter 0).
Additional taxon counts at higher levels (e. g. how many families are covered by a digital Fauna) should be given verbatim in the resource description, not here.</td></tr>

<tr id="Location_Created">
<td id="Iptc4xmpExt:LocationCreated" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: Iptc4xmpExt:LocationCreated</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://iptc.org/std/Iptc4xmpExt/1.0/xmlns/LocationCreated</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Location Created</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The location at which the media recording instrument was placed when the media was created.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">IPTC terms for Adobe XMP have URIs that are not resolvable. Instead, visit  <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iptc.org/std/photometadata/specification/IPTC-PhotoMetadata-201007_1.pdf">IPTC Standard Photo Metadata (July 2010)</a> for further documentation. Note that XMP does not have an explicit XML-Schema. Rather, an "XMP Schema" is actually defined in RDF.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The distinction between location shown and created is often irrelevant, and metadata may be assumed to be referring to location shown. It is recommended that the Location Shown field above always be used when known. However, in the case of position data automatically recorded by the instrument (e. g. EXIF GPS data) Location Created should be used to maintain information accuracy. When one but not both of Location Shown and Location Created are present, AC is silent about whether the provided one entails the other. A best practices document for a particular AC implementation might address this.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b> dcterms:coverage — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> (K2N is flat and does not support classes) — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Date_and_Time_Digitized">
<td id="digitizationDate" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: digitizationDate</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/terms/digitizationDate</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Date and Time Digitized</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Extended — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Date the first digital version was created, where different Date and Time Original (e. g. where photographic prints have been scanned). The date and time must comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org">W3C</a>) <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime">datetime practice</a>, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=40874">8601:2004</a>. AC datetime values may also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). See also  the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">wikipedia IS0 8601 entry</a> for further explanation and examples.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">This is often <i>not</i> the file creation or modification date. Use the international (ISO/xml) format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm (e. g. "2007-12-31" or "2007-12-31T14:59"). Where available, timezone information should be added. In the case of digital images containing EXIF, whereas the exif capture date does not contain time zone information, exif GPSDateStamp and GPSTimeStamp may be relevant as these include time-zone information. Compare also MWG (2010)<sup id="cite_ref-MWG2010_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MWG2010-2">[3]</a></sup>, which has best practice on handling time-zone-less EXIF date/time data.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">For digital cameras, this maps to the exif capture date —   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b> Date Digital — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b> k2n:Digitization_Date — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> mix2:<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">ImageCaptureMetadata/GeneralCaptureInformation/dateTimeCreated</a><sup id="cite_ref-mix2_0-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mix2-0">[1]</a></sup></td>
</tr> 




<tr id="Capture_Device">
<td id="captureDevice" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: captureDevice</td>

<tr>

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Information about technical aspects of the creation and digitization process of the resource. This includes modification steps ("retouching") after the initial resource capture.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Examples: Encoding method or settings, numbers of channels, lighting, audio sampling rate, frames per second, data rate, interlaced or progressive, multiflash lighting, remote control, automatic interval exposure. 
<p>Annotating whether and how a resource has been modified or edited significantly in ways that are not immediately obvious or expected to consumers is of special significance. Examples for images are: Removing a distracting twig from a picture, moving an object to a different surrounding, changing the color in parts of the image, or blurring the background of an image. Modifications that are standard practice and expected or obvious to users are not necessary to document; examples of such expected include changing resolution, cropping, minor sharpening or overall color correction, clearly perceptable modifications (adding arrows or labels, combination or multiple pictures into a table. If it is only known that significant modifications were made, but no details are known, a general statement like “Media may have been manipulated to improve appearance” may be appropriate.
</p>
See also Subject Preparation Technique.</td></tr>

<h2><span class="editsection">[<a href="/w/index.php?title=Audubon_Core_Term_List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Service Access Point Vocabulary">edit</a>]</span> <span class="mw-headline" id="Service_Access_Point_Vocabulary">Service Access Point Vocabulary</span></h2>
<h3><span class="editsection">[<a href="/w/index.php?title=Audubon_Core_Term_List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Service Access Point Class">edit</a>]</span> <span class="mw-headline" id="Service_Access_Point_Class"> Service Access Point Class </span></h3>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" border="0" style="border-top: 1px solid #CCC; border-left: 1px solid #CCC; margin-bottom:10px;">





<tr id="Service_Access_Point">
<td id="serviceAccessPoint" colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;background:#EEE;border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;padding-top:1.1em;font-size:100%;font-weight:bold;">Term: serviceAccessPoint</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Normative URI:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/terms/serviceAccessPoint</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Label</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Service Access Point</td></tr>
<tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">&#160;</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><b>Layer:</b> Core — <b>Required: </b>  No — <b>Repeatable: </b> Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Reference to an object (the "access point") of a class describing network access to the media resource, or related resource, that the AC metadata describes. What constitutes a class and objects therein is dependent on the representation (e.g., XML Schema, RDF, etc.), but for full compliance such a representation must provide for the application to the access point of each of the terms in the  <b><a href="/wiki/Audubon_Core_Term_List#Service_Access_Point_Properties" title="Audubon Core Term List"> Service Access Point Properties section</a></b> below.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">serviceAccessPoint is an attribute of the media being described, as are all other AC terms except those in the following section, which are attributes of the access point class. Depending on the specific model used, the value of serviceAccessPoint may be implemented through some form of nesting objects inside other objects, or through a unique identifier pointing to an access point object.</td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Use with the <b><a href="/wiki/Audubon_Core_Term_List#Service_Access_Point_Properties" title="Audubon Core Term List"> Service Access Point Properties</a></b> below. In particular, there is little point to having an instance of this class without a value for the Access URI and perhaps the dcterms:format. Implementers in specific constraint languages such as XML Schema or OWL may wish to make those two properties mandatory on instances.</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Crosswalk:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">   <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/">DublinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.adobe.com/devnet/xmp/">XMP:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/index.htm">DarwinCore:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.tdwg.org/activities/ncd/">NCD:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.morphbank.net/Help/Documents/">Morphbank:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://life.nbii.gov/">LIFE:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Resource_Metadata_Exchange_Agreement">K2N:</a></b>  — <b><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">MIX2.0:</a></b> </td>
</tr> 



</table>

<tr id="Format">

<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">The technical format of the resource (file format or physical medium).</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"><a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/#terms-format">dcterms:format</a></td></tr>

</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types [MIME]. This item is recommended for offline digital content. In cases where the provided URL includes a standard file extension from which the format can be inferred it is permissible to not provide this item.
<p>Three types of values are acceptable: (a) any MIME type; (b) common file extensions like txt, doc, odf, jpg/jpeg, png, pdf; (c) the following special values: Data-CD, Audio-CD, Video-CD, Data-DVD, Audio-DVD, Video-DVD-PAL, Video-DVD-NTSC, photographic slide, photographic print.
</p>
Compare Type for the content-type.</td></tr>

<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Definition:</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">What this ServiceAccessPoint provides. Suggested values are "Thumbnail", "Trailer", "Lower Quality", "Medium Quality", "Good Quality", "Best Quality", "Offline"</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Details</td>
<td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;"></td></tr>
<tr>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align:right;vertical-align:top;background:#EEE;border-right:1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em; font-family:Verdana,Arial,sans-serif;">Comments:</td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #CCC; border-bottom: 1px solid #CCC; padding:0.5em;">*Thumbnail: ServiceAccessPoint provides a thumbnail image, short sound clip, or short movie clip that can be used in addition to the resource to represent the media object, typically at lower quality and higher compression than the preview object. A typical size for a tiny thumbnail image may be 50-100 pixels in the longer dimension.
<ul><li>Trailer: ServiceAccessPoint provides video clip preview, in the form of a specifically authored "Trailer", which may provider somewhat different content than the original resource
</li><li>Lower Quality: ServiceAccessPoint provides a lower quality version of the media resource, suitable e. g. for web sites.
</li><li>Medium Quality: ServiceAccessPoint provides a medium quality version of the media resource, e. g. shortened in duration, or reduced size, using lower resolution or higher compression causing moderate artifacts.
</li><li>Good Quality: ServiceAccessPoint provides a good quality version of the media resource intended for resources displayed as primary information; e. g. an image between 800 and 1600 px in width or height.
</li><li>Best Quality: ServiceAccessPoint provides the highest available quality of the media resource, whatever its resolution or quality level.
</li><li>Offline: ServiceAccessPoint provides data about an offline resource.</td></tr>
</li></ul>
<tr>

<ol class="references"><li id="cite_note-mix2-0">↑ <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-0">1.0</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-1">1.1</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-2">1.2</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-3">1.3</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-4">1.4</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-5">1.5</a></sup> <sup><a href="#cite_ref-mix2_0-6">1.6</a></sup> mix2 = <a target="_blank" class="external free" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd">http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix20/mix20.xsd</a> --note <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/">MIX 2.0</a> provides an XML Schema provided by the U.S. Library of Congress as a representation of the U.S. <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.niso.org/kst/reports/standards?step=2&amp;gid=None&amp;project_key=b897b0cf3e2ee526252d9f830207b3cc9f3b6c2c">ANSI/NISO Z39.87</a> controlled vocabulary for still images.The text in the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.loc.gov/standards/mix/mix10/mix10.xsd">MIX 1.0</a> is designated as the schema corresponding to the <a target="_blank" class="external text" href="http://www.niso.org/kst/reports/standards?step=2&amp;gid=None&amp;project_key=b897b0cf3e2ee526252d9f830207b3cc9f3b6c2c">Z39.87 PDF document</a> remains a good source for details of the MIX 2.0 elements, which are not substantially different in detail from MIX 1.0</li>
<li id="cite_note-plus-1"><a href="#cite_ref-plus_1-0">↑</a> plus =&#160;?
